intro: Panmorphia lichenophila, commonly known as the variable lichen, is a unique species of lichen that exhibits a wide range of morphological variations. It belongs to the family Parmeliaceae and is characterized by its ability to adapt its thallus structure in response to environmental conditions. The lichen forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a green alga or cyanobacterium, which allows it to thrive in diverse habitats. It is typically found on tree bark, rocks, and soil surfaces in temperate and subtropical regions. Due to its morphological plasticity, it is often challenging to identify without microscopic examination.
